answers.answer: hi rahul, your problem require complete clinical evaluation and some test might also be required to make a diagnosis. It could be due to peripheral nerve involvement and there are many reasons for that. Are you a diabetic? Also, are you taking some other medication?
hi,yes i would advise you to get a blood sugar test done.are you also experiencing incraesing thirst and incraesed frequency of urination?

Hi Rahul, how old are you, are you a chronic smoker or consume alcohol. it could be due to neuritis or even due to withdrawl symptoms. you do require to get your basic investigation and consult a physician who can evaluate you in systametic way.

Hi,Please consult an orthopaedician for the tingling sensation on your hands.Thoracic outlet syndraome can cause such symptoms.This could well disturb your sleep.Do a blood work.Quit smoking if you are a smoker.How old are you?Do you have a family history of dibetes?Rule out diabetes by consulting a diabetologist if the problem persists..Goodluck.

question: Hi Doctor,last month i had a feeling like pins and needles on my hands and feet,after a week i felt some inset moving like sensation on my hands and legs and all over the body,for the past two weeks i had a tinglig feeling on my right hand middle finger,still it continous,and for the past two weeks i am not getting sleep at all,please advice me what ma be the cause of this problem?and what is the treatment,please advice
title: Not Getting Sleep
